title: How to Make Chicken Caesar Salad Wraps

steps.headline: Oil the grill grates.
steps.description: This will prevent your food from sticking.

steps.headline: Preheat the grill to medium-high.
Season the chicken breasts.
steps.description: Use 1/2 teaspoons of the salt, 1/4 teaspoons of the pepper, and the cayenne seasoning.

steps.headline: Grill the chicken until cooked through.
steps.description: This should be 6 to 8 minutes on each side.

steps.headline: Remove from the grill.
steps.description: Let cool on a plate until lukewarm.

steps.headline: Slice the chicken into thin strips.

steps.description: Use a whisk to mix the egg yolk, anchovies, garlic, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, leftover 1/4 teaspoon salt and leftover 1/8 teaspoon pepper together.

steps.headline: Continue whisking until mixture is frothy.
Slowly add the remaining 1/2 cup of olive oil.
steps.description: This should be done just a couple drops at a time. Continue whisking as you add the olive oil.

steps.headline: Add the Parmesan to the dressing.

Toss the romaine lettuce with the dressing that you didn't set aside.
Warm the tortillas over an open flame or in a skillet.
steps.description: Heat for 10 to 15 seconds on each side.

steps.headline: Place the tortillas flat on a clean cutting board.
Spread one tablespoon of the reserved dressing on the lower 1/3 of each tortilla with a basting brush, then leave about two inches of space by each edge.
Lay 1/4 of the chicken on each tortilla.
steps.description: Place the chicken on top of the spread dressing.

steps.headline: Add 1/4 cup coleslaw on top of the chicken.
Top off with 1/4 of the salad on each tortilla.
steps.description: Remember to keep all your ingredients within the lower 1/3 of the tortilla.

steps.headline: Fold the end of the tortilla in towards the center.

steps.headline: Continue to fold and roll the tortilla.

steps.headline: Use a sharp knife to cut each wrap diagonally in half.
Serve immediately.

text: Cook the Chicken Oil the grill grates. This will prevent your food from sticking. Preheat the grill to medium-high.  Season the chicken breasts. Use 1/2 teaspoons of the salt, 1/4 teaspoons of the pepper, and the cayenne seasoning. Grill the chicken until cooked through. This should be 6 to 8 minutes on each side. Remove from the grill. Let cool on a plate until lukewarm. Slice the chicken into thin strips.  Make the Dressing Get a medium mixing bowl. Use a whisk to mix the egg yolk, anchovies, garlic, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, leftover 1/4 teaspoon salt and leftover 1/8 teaspoon pepper together. Continue whisking until mixture is frothy.  Slowly add the remaining 1/2 cup of olive oil. This should be done just a couple drops at a time. Continue whisking as you add the olive oil. Add the Parmesan to the dressing. Mix until well incorporated. Set 4 tablespoons of the dressing to the side.  Assemble the Wraps Toss the romaine lettuce with the dressing that you didn't set aside.  Warm the tortillas over an open flame or in a skillet. Heat for 10 to 15 seconds on each side. Place the tortillas flat on a clean cutting board.  Spread one tablespoon of the reserved dressing on the lower 1/3 of each tortilla with a basting brush, then leave about two inches of space by each edge.  Lay 1/4 of the chicken on each tortilla. Place the chicken on top of the spread dressing. Add 1/4 cup coleslaw on top of the chicken.  Top off with 1/4 of the salad on each tortilla. Remember to keep all your ingredients within the lower 1/3 of the tortilla. Fold the end of the tortilla in towards the center. It doesn't matter which end you start with. Continue to fold and roll the tortilla. You should be left with tight log forms. Set the wrap down so that the seam is on the bottom. This will prevent it from coming unwrapped. Use a sharp knife to cut each wrap diagonally in half.  Serve immediately.
